meanings.sent1: The truck was loaded with boxes for delivery.
meanings.sent2: The ship was loaded with supplies for the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The car looked funny with all the toys loaded in the back.
meanings.sent4: Her backpack was like a loaded treasure chest ready for an adventure.
meanings.sent5: The plane was so loaded with passengers that it felt like a crowded bus.

meanings.sent1: The soldier carried a loaded gun into battle.
meanings.sent2: The hunter always makes sure his rifle is loaded before going hunting.
meanings.sent3: The toy gun looked silly with its loaded foam darts.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a loaded weapon, ready to strike at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The pirate ship was loaded with cannons, ready for a sea battle.

meanings.sent1: After the party, he stumbled out, completely loaded.
meanings.sent2: She regretted getting loaded at the bar last night.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked like it was loaded on catnip, running around crazily.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the room, sounding like a loaded hyena.
meanings.sent5: The clown at the circus acted like he was loaded with happiness.

meanings.definition: Having a lot of money or resources.
meanings.sent1: The businessman was loaded with cash after the successful deal.
meanings.sent2: The company was loaded with talented employees.
meanings.sent3: The garden was loaded with colorful flowers, a true sight to see.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a loaded library, full of knowledge and wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was so loaded with gold that it sparkled in the sunlight.
